content.text: PHP Regular Expressions
What is a Regular Expression?
A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern. When you search for data in a text, you can use this search pattern to describe what you are searching for.
content.html: A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern. When you search for data in a text, you can use this search pattern to describe what you are searching for.

content.text: A regular expression can be a single character, or a more complicated pattern.
content.html: A regular expression can be a single character, or a more complicated pattern.

content.text: Regular expressions can be used to perform all types of text search and text replace operations.
content.html: Regular expressions can be used to perform all types of text search and text replace operations.

content.text: Syntax
In PHP, regular expressions are strings composed of delimiters, a pattern and optional modifiers.
content.html: In PHP, regular expressions are strings composed of delimiters, a pattern and optional modifiers.

content.code_html: $exp = "/w3schools/i";

content.text: In the example above, / is the delimiter , w3schools is the pattern that is being searched for, and i is a modifier that makes the search case-insensitive.
content.html: In the example above, / is the delimiter, w3schools is the pattern that is being searched for, and i is a modifier that makes the search case-insensitive.

content.text: The delimiter can be any character that is not a letter, number, backslash or space. The most common delimiter is the forward slash (/), but when your pattern contains forward slashes it is convenient to choose other delimiters such as # or ~.
content.html: The delimiter can be any character that is not a letter, number, backslash or space. The most common delimiter is the forward slash (/), but when your pattern contains forward slashes it is convenient to choose other delimiters such as # or ~.

content.text: Regular Expression Functions
PHP provides a variety of functions that allow you to use regular expressions.
content.html: PHP provides a variety of functions that allow you to use regular expressions.

content.text: The most common functions are:
content.html: The most common functions are:

content.code_html:
Function Description
preg_match() Returns 1 if the pattern was found in the string and 0 if not
preg_match_all() Returns the number of times the pattern was found in the string, which may also be 0
preg_replace() Returns a new string where matched patterns have been replaced with another string

content.text: Using preg_match()
The preg_match() function will tell you whether a string contains matches of a pattern.
content.html: The preg_match() function will tell you whether a string contains matches of a pattern.

content.code_html:
$str = "Visit W3Schools";
$pattern = "/w3schools/i";
echo preg_match($pattern, $str);

content.text: Using preg_match_all()
The preg_match_all() function will tell you how many matches were found for a pattern in a string.
content.html: The preg_match_all() function will tell you how many matches were found for a pattern in a string.

content.code:
$str

=

"The rain in SPAIN falls mainly on the plains."
;


$pattern

=

"/ain/i"
;


echo

preg_match_all
(
$pattern
,

$str
)
;
content.code_html:
$str = "The rain in SPAIN falls mainly on the plains.";
$pattern = "/ain/i";
echo preg_match_all($pattern, $str);

content.text: Using preg_replace()
The preg_replace() function will replace all of the matches of the pattern in a string with another string.
content.html: The preg_replace() function will replace all of the matches of the pattern in a string with another string.

content.code_html:
$str = "Visit Microsoft!";
$pattern = "/microsoft/i";
echo preg_replace($pattern, "W3Schools", $str);

content.text: Regular Expression Modifiers
Modifiers can change how a search is performed.
content.html: Modifiers can change how a search is performed.

content.code_html:
Modifier Description Try it
i Performs a case-insensitive search Try it »
m Performs a multiline search (patterns that search for a match at the beginning or end of a string will now match the beginning or end of each line) Try it »
u Enables correct matching of UTF-8 encoded patterns

content.text: Regular Expression Patterns
Brackets are used to find a range of characters:
content.html: Brackets are used to find a range of characters:

content.code_html:
Expression Description Try it
[abc] Find one or many of the characters inside the brackets Try it »
[^abc] Find any character NOT between the brackets Try it »
[a-z] Find any character alphabetically between two letters Try it »
[A-z] Find any character alphabetically between a specified upper-case letter and a specified lower-case letter Try it »
[A-Z] Find any character alphabetically between two upper-case letters. Try it »
[123] Find one or many of the digits inside the brackets Try it »
[0-5] Find any digits between the two numbers Try it »
[0-9] Find any digits Try it »

content.text: Metacharacters
Metacharacters are characters with a special meaning:
content.html: Metacharacters are characters with a special meaning:

content.code_html:
Metacharacter Description Try it
| Find a match for any one of the patterns separated by | as in: cat|dog|fish Try it »
. Find any character Try it »
^ Finds a match as the beginning of a string as in: ^Hello Try it »
$ Finds a match at the end of the string as in: World$ Try it »
\d Find any digits Try it »
\D Find any non-digits Try it »
\s Find any whitespace character Try it »
\S Find any non-whitespace character Try it »
\w Find any alphabetical letter (a to Z) and digit (0 to 9) Try it »
\W Find any non-alphabetical and non-digit character Try it »
\b Find a match at the beginning of a word like this: \bWORD, or at the end of a word like this: WORD\b Try it »
\uxxxx Find the Unicode character specified by the hexadecimal number xxxx Try it »

content.text: Quantifiers
Quantifiers define quantities:
content.html: Quantifiers define quantities:

content.code_html:
Quantifier Description Try it
n+ Matches any string that contains at least one n Try it »
n* Matches any string that contains zero or more occurrences of n
n? Matches any string that contains zero or one occurrences of n
n{3} Matches any string that contains a sequence of 3 n's Try it »
n{2, 5} Matches any string that contains a sequence of at least 2, but not more that 5 n's Try it »
n{3,} Matches any string that contains a sequence of at least 3 n's Try it »

content.text: Note: If your expression needs to search for one of the special characters you can use a backslash ( \ ) to escape them. For example, to search for one or more question marks you can use the following expression: $pattern = '/\?+/';
content.html: Note: If your expression needs to search for one of the special characters you can use a backslash ( \ ) to escape them. For example, to search for one or more question marks you can use the following expression: $pattern = '/\?+/';

content.text: Grouping
You can use parentheses ( ) to apply quantifiers to entire patterns. They also can be used to select parts of the pattern to be used as a match.
content.html: You can use parentheses ( ) to apply quantifiers to entire patterns. They also can be used to select parts of the pattern to be used as a match.

content.code_html:
$str = "Apples and bananas.";
$pattern = "/ba(na){2}/i";
echo preg_match($pattern, $str);

content.text: Complete RegExp Reference
For a complete reference, go to our Complete PHP Regular Expression Reference .
content.html: For a complete reference, go to our Complete PHP Regular Expression Reference.

content.text: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Regular Expression functions.
content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Regular Expression functions.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What will the following code return? $str = 'Which watch would you watch?'; $pattern = '/w/i'; echo preg_match_all($pattern, $str);
content.html:
What will the following code return?
$str = 'Which watch would you watch?';
$pattern = '/w/i';
echo preg_match_all($pattern, $str);
